title: Magnetic field due to parallel wires

content.question: Two long, parallel wires <math alttext="30 centimeters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> apart carry currents in the same direction. Wire <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math> has a current of <math alttext="4 amperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and Wire <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> has a current of <math alttext="8 amperes" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. In the plane of the wires, how far from Wire <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math> is the net magnetic field zero?

choices.label: There is no position between the wires where the net magnetic field is zero.

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
